note.p: Scottish-born journalist. Son of Alexander Brockie and Janet Freir of Lauder, Berwickshire. Articled to a solicitor in Melrose, 1825; subsequently worked in Edinburgh; farmed with his father near Lauder. Clerk in a flour mill, in Melrose, 1841; schoolteacher at Kailzie, Peebleshire, 1843, but had to leave after joining the Free Church. Editor of the Border Watch, a Free Church paper, at Kelso, and at Galashiels from 1846. Editor, North and South Shields Gazette; resigned because of ill health, 1853. Opened a school and became editor of the South Shields Times until 1873. Wrote on local history and folklore.
